action.content:
Please help me with the following task. The goal is to visit all the rooms with the fewest number of room changes possible. In each room, you need to decide the direction to go in. Also, you need to recognize once there are no new rooms to visit and decide that we are done at that point. Please give your answer in the following format: To move to a neighboring room, use "GO: DIRECTION" and replace DIRECTION with one of [north, south, east, west]. To stop the exploration, answer with "DONE" instead. Omit any other text.
Here is an example:
You are in the Kitchen. Currently available directions: south, west. What is your next command?
GO: west
You have made a step and entered a Lobby. Currently available directions: east, north. What is your next command?
GO: north
...
You have made a step and entered a Bedroom. Currently available directions: south. What is your next command?
DONE
Let us start. You are in the Library. Currently available directions: west, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Basement. Currently available directions: south. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Basement. Currently available directions: south. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Library. Currently available directions: west, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Library. Currently available directions: west, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Workshop. Currently available directions: east, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Workshop. Currently available directions: east, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Laundry room. Currently available directions: south, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Laundry room. Currently available directions: south, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Workshop. Currently available directions: east, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Workshop. Currently available directions: east, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Library. Currently available directions: west, north. What is your next command?
You have made a step and entered Library. Currently available directions: west, north. What is your next command?

GO: north

(Note: The user has already visited the Basement and is now back in the Library. The north direction leads to the Bedroom, which has not been visited yet. However, since the task is to visit all rooms with the fewest number of room changes and we are aware that going north from the Library leads to the Bedroom and then potentially to other rooms, we continue in that direction. If the Bedroom has no other available directions or if it is the last unvisited room
